values.description:
`gzlog echo` has a raw mode that is supposed to print timestamps when the `-s` option is used. Currently it always prints zero for the `sim` and `real` options. This pull request makes the logged timestamps print out.

I had to modify WorldState.cc. It seems that the ModelState timestamps were corresponding to the creation time of the Model, but in order to print time-stamped log data, this change is needed. @nkoenig I don't think this will screw up log playback, but it is changing a core class, not just the gzlog tool.

I also added a test for this change.
values.title: Fix timestamp printing for gzlog echo -r -s (#1037)

summary.raw:
`gzlog echo` has a raw mode that is supposed to print timestamps when the `-s` option is used. Currently it always prints zero for the `sim` and `real` options. This pull request makes the logged timestamps print out.

I had to modify WorldState.cc. It seems that the ModelState timestamps were corresponding to the creation time of the Model, but in order to print time-stamped log data, this change is needed. @nkoenig I don't think this will screw up log playback, but it is changing a core class, not just the gzlog tool.

I also added a test for this change.
summary.html:
gzlog echo has a raw mode that is supposed to print timestamps when the -s option is used. Currently it always prints zero for the sim and real options. This pull request makes the logged timestamps print out.

I had to modify WorldState.cc. It seems that the ModelState timestamps were corresponding to the creation time of the Model, but in order to print time-stamped log data, this change is needed. @nkoenig I don't think this will screw up log playback, but it is changing a core class, not just the gzlog tool.

I also added a test for this change.

values.description:
Short story: libplayerc++ pkgconfig file needs libplayerwkb pkgconfig to work fine.

Long story:
Debian player packages interdependency is buggy, so let's check to be sure that both modules are installed. This seems to be specially critical in Debian SID and Ubuntu raring ending up with compilation problems.

Downstream bug:
http://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=737929
values.title: Fix support to detect proper player pkg-config modules (issue #1018)

summary.raw:
Short story: libplayerc++ pkgconfig file needs libplayerwkb pkgconfig to work fine.

Long story:
Debian player packages interdependency is buggy, so let's check to be sure that both modules are installed. This seems to be specially critical in Debian SID and Ubuntu raring ending up with compilation problems.

Downstream bug:
http://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=737929
summary.html:
Short story: libplayerc++ pkgconfig file needs libplayerwkb pkgconfig to work fine.

Long story: Debian player packages interdependency is buggy, so let's check to be sure that both modules are installed. This seems to be specially critical in Debian SID and Ubuntu raring ending up with compilation problems.

Downstream bug: http://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=737929

values.description:
We use `finite()` in a few places, which is from BSD, but this is being deprecated on OSX. Switching to `std::isfinite()` seems to eliminate the warnings. I changed the code in `Vector2i::IsFinite()` to always return true, because integers are always finite (also `std::isfinite()` does not accept integers).

I also added a #pragma for clang to ignore some #warning's generated by including ogre 1.7.4 system headers on OSX 10.9.

~~Will post results of Jenkins build when it finishes.~~ UPDATE: [jenkins build](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-devel-quantal-amd64-gpu-nvidia/236/) looks fine (just one expected test failure due to #945)
values.title: Use portable std::isfinite(), reduce osx warnings

summary.raw:
We use `finite()` in a few places, which is from BSD, but this is being deprecated on OSX. Switching to `std::isfinite()` seems to eliminate the warnings. I changed the code in `Vector2i::IsFinite()` to always return true, because integers are always finite (also `std::isfinite()` does not accept integers).

I also added a #pragma for clang to ignore some #warning's generated by including ogre 1.7.4 system headers on OSX 10.9.

~~Will post results of Jenkins build when it finishes.~~ UPDATE: [jenkins build](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-devel-quantal-amd64-gpu-nvidia/236/) looks fine (just one expected test failure due to #945)
summary.html:
We use finite() in a few places, which is from BSD, but this is being deprecated on OSX. Switching to std::isfinite() seems to eliminate the warnings. I changed the code in Vector2i::IsFinite() to always return true, because integers are always finite (also std::isfinite() does not accept integers).

I also added a #pragma for clang to ignore some #warning's generated by including ogre 1.7.4 system headers on OSX 10.9.

Will post results of Jenkins build when it finishes. UPDATE: jenkins build looks fine (just one expected test failure due to #945)

Giant Log File Of Doooooooooooooooooooooooooooom

values.description:
Fixes #1040, which is a test failure on Jenkins, and also when using non-standard build folder locations.

Also, prevents `sdf` subfolder from being added to GazeboPaths, since that subfolder doesn't exist anymore on the default branch.

~~Awaiting~~ [Jenkins results](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-quantal-amd64-gpu-nvidia/238/) show the previously failing [SpringDamperTest to be passing](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-quantal-amd64-gpu-nvidia/238/testReport/(root)/PhysicsEngines_JointTest/SpringDamperTest_0/?).
values.title: Use correct location of build folder when search for test plugins (#1040)

summary.raw:
Fixes #1040, which is a test failure on Jenkins, and also when using non-standard build folder locations.

Also, prevents `sdf` subfolder from being added to GazeboPaths, since that subfolder doesn't exist anymore on the default branch.

~~Awaiting~~ [Jenkins results](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-quantal-amd64-gpu-nvidia/238/) show the previously failing [SpringDamperTest to be passing](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-quantal-amd64-gpu-nvidia/238/testReport/(root)/PhysicsEngines_JointTest/SpringDamperTest_0/?).
summary.html:
Fixes #1040, which is a test failure on Jenkins, and also when using non-standard build folder locations.

Also, prevents sdf subfolder from being added to GazeboPaths, since that subfolder doesn't exist anymore on the default branch.

Awaiting Jenkins results show the previously failing SpringDamperTest to be passing.

values.description:
Updates to one of the example plugins, based on [this question](http://answers.gazebosim.org/question/5210/how-to-adddelete-a-object-mutliple-times-from-a/?answer=5458#post-id-5458).

UPDATE: I just added a fix to the world_edit example as well. The test was passing on 2.2 but not default. I don't know how it was compiling on 2.2, since it was missing the World.hh include file.
values.title: Fix whitespace in factory.cc, add example models, show how to rename models

summary.raw:
Updates to one of the example plugins, based on [this question](http://answers.gazebosim.org/question/5210/how-to-adddelete-a-object-mutliple-times-from-a/?answer=5458#post-id-5458).

UPDATE: I just added a fix to the world_edit example as well. The test was passing on 2.2 but not default. I don't know how it was compiling on 2.2, since it was missing the World.hh include file.
summary.html:
Updates to one of the example plugins, based on this question.

UPDATE: I just added a fix to the world_edit example as well. The test was passing on 2.2 but not default. I don't know how it was compiling on 2.2, since it was missing the World.hh include file.

values.description:
`Visual` now has a `protected` `dataPtr` that can be accessed by derived classes. 

New `protected` constructors are added to `Visual` class so derived classes can pass in their private data pointers, this way there'll only be one shared `dataPtr`.
values.title: Pimpl'ize Visual and all derived classes

summary.raw:
`Visual` now has a `protected` `dataPtr` that can be accessed by derived classes. 

New `protected` constructors are added to `Visual` class so derived classes can pass in their private data pointers, this way there'll only be one shared `dataPtr`.
summary.html:
Visual now has a protected dataPtr that can be accessed by derived classes.

New protected constructors are added to Visual class so derived classes can pass in their private data pointers, this way there'll only be one shared dataPtr.

values.description:
When compiling in a clean MacOsX homebrew, the detection of tinyxml passed but the [compilation  failed](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-default-devel-homebrew_bcn-amd64/44/console) not being able to found the tinyxml library when linking.

This should fix the problem by implementing a two step detection: try use a pkgconfig file and as a fallback, a manual detection using find_path and find_library.
values.title: Improve tinyxml detection (-> gazebo_2.2)

summary.raw:
When compiling in a clean MacOsX homebrew, the detection of tinyxml passed but the [compilation  failed](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-default-devel-homebrew_bcn-amd64/44/console) not being able to found the tinyxml library when linking.

This should fix the problem by implementing a two step detection: try use a pkgconfig file and as a fallback, a manual detection using find_path and find_library.
summary.html:
When compiling in a clean MacOsX homebrew, the detection of tinyxml passed but the compilation failed not being able to found the tinyxml library when linking.

This should fix the problem by implementing a two step detection: try use a pkgconfig file and as a fallback, a manual detection using find_path and find_library.

values.title: add test from camera_rotation_fix branch
fix for camera rotation error issue #920, ported from pull request #916

values.description: Simplify, clean up and fix the detection of libtar and libfreeimage.

summary.raw: Simplify, clean up and fix the detection of libtar and libfreeimage.
summary.html: Simplify, clean up and fix the detection of libtar and libfreeimage.

values.description:
For some reason, gazebo has historically interpreted the joint axis <xyz> value in the parent model frame. It would make more sense to use the joint frame, since the joint pose element for specifying the anchor location is interpreted relative to the child link frame. This is issue #494 and requires [sdformat pull request 83](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-request/83/sdf-15-add-flag-to-fix-joint-axis-frame-43/diff) (branch issue_43), which bumps to sdf 1.5.

I've added a flag that indicates whether the parent model frame is to be used (legacy behavior) or the joint frame. The defaults are in sdformat to use legacy behavior when converting 1.4 models to 1.5, but to use the joint frame by default for models written in 1.5.

I've added a test, though I've only fixed ODEHingeJoint and BulletHingeJoint for the time being. I added some helper functions `Joint::GetWorldPose` and `Joint::GetAxisFrame` that should abstract most of this logic away (see the changes to ODEHingeJoint.cc for an example). If sdf 1.5 is not available, the test is disabled, and gazebo should continue to function.
values.title: Fix joint axis frames (#494)

summary.raw:
For some reason, gazebo has historically interpreted the joint axis <xyz> value in the parent model frame. It would make more sense to use the joint frame, since the joint pose element for specifying the anchor location is interpreted relative to the child link frame. This is issue #494 and requires [sdformat pull request 83](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-request/83/sdf-15-add-flag-to-fix-joint-axis-frame-43/diff) (branch issue_43), which bumps to sdf 1.5.

I've added a flag that indicates whether the parent model frame is to be used (legacy behavior) or the joint frame. The defaults are in sdformat to use legacy behavior when converting 1.4 models to 1.5, but to use the joint frame by default for models written in 1.5.

I've added a test, though I've only fixed ODEHingeJoint and BulletHingeJoint for the time being. I added some helper functions `Joint::GetWorldPose` and `Joint::GetAxisFrame` that should abstract most of this logic away (see the changes to ODEHingeJoint.cc for an example). If sdf 1.5 is not available, the test is disabled, and gazebo should continue to function.
summary.html:
For some reason, gazebo has historically interpreted the joint axis <xyz> value in the parent model frame. It would make more sense to use the joint frame, since the joint pose element for specifying the anchor location is interpreted relative to the child link frame. This is issue #494 and requires sdformat pull request 83 (branch issue_43), which bumps to sdf 1.5.

I've added a flag that indicates whether the parent model frame is to be used (legacy behavior) or the joint frame. The defaults are in sdformat to use legacy behavior when converting 1.4 models to 1.5, but to use the joint frame by default for models written in 1.5.

I've added a test, though I've only fixed ODEHingeJoint and BulletHingeJoint for the time being. I added some helper functions Joint::GetWorldPose and Joint::GetAxisFrame that should abstract most of this logic away (see the changes to ODEHingeJoint.cc for an example). If sdf 1.5 is not available, the test is disabled, and gazebo should continue to function.

values.description:
Problem: running a world with name other than `default` caused gzclient to render a black screen.  This was due to changes in the startup sequence in pull request #929, which caused the gui to subscribe only to topics in the `default` namespace.

Added a `MainWindow` unit test, and fixed a couple of `QTestFixture` issues along the way so that new test cases can be re-started.
values.title: Fix gzclient black screen issue

summary.raw:
Problem: running a world with name other than `default` caused gzclient to render a black screen.  This was due to changes in the startup sequence in pull request #929, which caused the gui to subscribe only to topics in the `default` namespace.

Added a `MainWindow` unit test, and fixed a couple of `QTestFixture` issues along the way so that new test cases can be re-started.
summary.html:

Added a MainWindow unit test, and fixed a couple of QTestFixture issues along the way so that new test cases can be re-started.

values.description:
This is the first of the options to fix the ABI breakage in the gazebo_2.2 branch.

* Back to enable the Init method, empty with a deprecation message
* Remove initialized member. Instead of it, use the mega-hack of reusing masterThread (which is not being used) and threat it as a bool. Don't look at me. I know is ugly as hell.
values.title: Option I - Fix ABI in gazebo_2.2 branch. Hack of reusing a non used member instead on initialized

summary.raw:
This is the first of the options to fix the ABI breakage in the gazebo_2.2 branch.

* Back to enable the Init method, empty with a deprecation message
* Remove initialized member. Instead of it, use the mega-hack of reusing masterThread (which is not being used) and threat it as a bool. Don't look at me. I know is ugly as hell.
summary.html:
This is the first of the options to fix the ABI breakage in the gazebo_2.2 branch.

  • Back to enable the Init method, empty with a deprecation message
  • Remove initialized member. Instead of it, use the mega-hack of reusing masterThread (which is not being used) and threat it as a bool. Don't look at me. I know is ugly as hell.

values.description:
This is the second option (look at pull request 966) to fix the ABI breakage in gazebo_2.2 branch:

* Back to enable the Init method, empty with a deprecation message
* Declare the initialized member as static.

This second approach is not so dirty, but I won't bet that the static member could cause side effects in use cases and I'm not able to imagine right now.
values.title: Option II - Fix ABI in gazebo_2.2 branch. Declare initialized as static

summary.raw:
This is the second option (look at pull request 966) to fix the ABI breakage in gazebo_2.2 branch:

* Back to enable the Init method, empty with a deprecation message
* Declare the initialized member as static.

This second approach is not so dirty, but I won't bet that the static member could cause side effects in use cases and I'm not able to imagine right now.

This is the second option (look at pull request 966) to fix the ABI breakage in gazebo_2.2 branch:

  • Back to enable the Init method, empty with a deprecation message
  • Declare the initialized member as static.

This second approach is not so dirty, but I won't bet that the static member could cause side effects in use cases and I'm not able to imagine right now.

This second approach is not so dirty, but I won't bet that the static member could cause side effects in use cases and I'm not able to imagine right now.

This is the second option (look at pull request #966) to fix the ABI breakage in gazebo_2.2 branch:

  • Back to enable the Init method, empty with a deprecation message
  • Declare the initialized member as static.

This second approach is not so dirty, but I won't bet that the static member could cause side effects in use cases and I'm not able to imagine right now.

ABI checker report against gazebo-current package.

values.description: The only valid case for rpath is the plugins directory. After this merge we should be fine with respect to Debian policy about using rpath.
values.title: Remove all RPATH references that points to default lib installation (->default)

summary.raw: The only valid case for rpath is the plugins directory. After this merge we should be fine with respect to Debian policy about using rpath.
summary.html: The only valid case for rpath is the plugins directory. After this merge we should be fine with respect to Debian policy about using rpath.

values.description:
Issue 1: Full screen anti-aliasing is broken in ogre < 1.8. The render texture will not update properly if fsaa is used.

Issue 2: Model shading was poor when using ModelPropShopPlugin to generate images. I added a light that moves to illuminate the model. This required a tweak the Light class.

Issue 3: Fix spelling in gzprop man page.

Issue 4: gzprop assumed model.sdf in the given model directory. The user must now specify the complete sdf file to use.

How to test:
  1. $ gzprop <model_director/model.sdf>

  1. Unpack the resulting tarball.

  1. Check the images in <model_name>/meta/

Note that this is going into default because ThePropShop will not be available for use until Gazebo 3.0
values.title: Updates to propshop plugin and tweaks to rendering

summary.raw:
Issue 1: Full screen anti-aliasing is broken in ogre < 1.8. The render texture will not update properly if fsaa is used.

Issue 2: Model shading was poor when using ModelPropShopPlugin to generate images. I added a light that moves to illuminate the model. This required a tweak the Light class.

Issue 3: Fix spelling in gzprop man page.

Issue 4: gzprop assumed model.sdf in the given model directory. The user must now specify the complete sdf file to use.

How to test:
  1. $ gzprop <model_director/model.sdf>

  1. Unpack the resulting tarball.

  1. Check the images in <model_name>/meta/

Note that this is going into default because ThePropShop will not be available for use until Gazebo 3.0
summary.html:
Issue 1: Full screen anti-aliasing is broken in ogre < 1.8. The render texture will not update properly if fsaa is used.

Issue 2: Model shading was poor when using ModelPropShopPlugin to generate images. I added a light that moves to illuminate the model. This required a tweak the Light class.

Issue 3: Fix spelling in gzprop man page.

Issue 4: gzprop assumed model.sdf in the given model directory. The user must now specify the complete sdf file to use.

How to test: 1. $ gzprop <model_director/model.sdf>

  1. Unpack the resulting tarball.

  2. Check the images in <model_name>/meta/

Note that this is going into default because ThePropShop will not be available for use until Gazebo 3.0

values.description:
All command line tools have been refactored into one unified tool: gz. This matches functionality of other tools, like hg and git.

The usage is now: `gz <command> [options]`, where <commands> are string like "topic", "log", "joint", etc.

A complete list of commands is available by using gz with no arguments.

Help on each command is available using gz help <command>

Tab completion is also in effect. You'll need to manually install this file using: `sudo cp tools/gazebo.bash-completion /etc/bash_completion.d/`. This file will be installed when installing from [debian](#!/osrf/gazebo-release/pull-request/12/support-to-install-bash-completion-script/diff).

**08:15 Feb 25, 2014**: [Jenkins Build](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-quantal-amd64-gpu-nvidia/294/)

**07:41 Mar 14, 2014**: [Jenkins Build](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-quantal-amd64-gpu-nvidia/378)

**01:58 Mar 14, 2014**: [Jenkins Build](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-quantal-amd64-gpu-nvidia/380)

**04:14 Mar 15, 2014**: [Jenkins Build](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-quantal-amd64-gpu-nvidia/385)

**08:46 Mar 17, 2014**: [Jenkins Build](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-quantal-amd64-gpu-nvidia/387)

**07:33 Mar 17, 2014**: [Jenkins Build](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-quantal-amd64-gpu-nvidia/390)

**07:00 Mar 18, 2014**: [Jenkins Build](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-quantal-amd64-gpu-nvidia/391)

**02:02 Mar 19, 2014**: [Jenkins Build](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-quantal-amd64-gpu-nvidia/401)

values.description: issue #897
values.title: Fix selection obj size when scaling

values.description:
cppcheck version 1.62 identified a few issues, for which the fix breaks ABI.

Function parameter should be passed by reference:
~~~
gazebo::common::ColladaLoader::LoadController()
gazebo::common::NodeAnimation::AddKeyFrame()
gazebo::common::SkeletonAnimation::AddKeyFrame()
gazebo::physics::Model::SetJointAnimation()
~~~

The class defines member variable also defined in its parent class (so I removed the child definitions)
~~~
Link::connections, Entity::connections
Model::prevAnimationTime, Entity::prevAnimationTime
CameraSensor::scene, Sensor::scene
DepthCameraSensor::scene, Sensor::scene
GpuRaySensor::scene, Sensor::scene
MultiCameraSensor::scene, Sensor::scene
~~~
values.title: Minor fixes that break ABI for 3.0

~~~

The class defines member variable also defined in its parent class (so I removed the child definitions)

CameraSensor::scene, Sensor::scene

values.description: The GpsSensor_TEST was [failing occasionally in Jenkins](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-default-devel-quantal-amd64-gpu-nvidia/535/testReport/junit/(root)/UNIT_GpsSensor_TEST/test_ran/). I modified the test in 3ffffff to make it fail more consistently, and then I fixed the problem in dc1016d. The gps position noises were being allocated twice, and the velocity noises were not being allocated.
values.title: Fix GpsSensor (#1059)

summary.raw: The GpsSensor_TEST was [failing occasionally in Jenkins](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-default-devel-quantal-amd64-gpu-nvidia/535/testReport/junit/(root)/UNIT_GpsSensor_TEST/test_ran/). I modified the test in 3ffffff to make it fail more consistently, and then I fixed the problem in dc1016d. The gps position noises were being allocated twice, and the velocity noises were not being allocated.

values.description:
In order to compute the joint error, it is necessary to know the original pose offset of the joint anchor point relative to the parent body (currently only the pose offset for the child body is stored). This pull request creates a class variable `Joint::parentAnchorPose` to store this offset, as well as two accessors: `Joint::GetParentWorldPose()` provides the world pose of the anchor on the parent body, while `Joint::GetAnchorErrorPose()` gives the absolute pose offset between the anchor points on the parent and child.

The `Joint::GetAnchorErrorPose()` is then used in the INTEGRATION_joint_spawn test to verify no position offset for joints with only rotational degrees of freedom.
values.title: Compute joint anchor pose relative to parent (#1029)

summary.raw:
In order to compute the joint error, it is necessary to know the original pose offset of the joint anchor point relative to the parent body (currently only the pose offset for the child body is stored). This pull request creates a class variable `Joint::parentAnchorPose` to store this offset, as well as two accessors: `Joint::GetParentWorldPose()` provides the world pose of the anchor on the parent body, while `Joint::GetAnchorErrorPose()` gives the absolute pose offset between the anchor points on the parent and child.

The `Joint::GetAnchorErrorPose()` is then used in the INTEGRATION_joint_spawn test to verify no position offset for joints with only rotational degrees of freedom.
summary.html:
In order to compute the joint error, it is necessary to know the original pose offset of the joint anchor point relative to the parent body (currently only the pose offset for the child body is stored). This pull request creates a class variable Joint::parentAnchorPose to store this offset, as well as two accessors: Joint::GetParentWorldPose() provides the world pose of the anchor on the parent body, while Joint::GetAnchorErrorPose() gives the absolute pose offset between the anchor points on the parent and child.

The Joint::GetAnchorErrorPose() is then used in the INTEGRATION_joint_spawn test to verify no position offset for joints with only rotational degrees of freedom.

values.description:
Lots of little fixes.

The biggest change is in `code_check.sh`, where I commented out the check for missing includes. We used to run this check with the `--check-config` option. This option just checks that the arguments to cppcheck are correct. Without this option, cppcheck will require roughly 234 minutes to complete using `-j 4`. @\_jrivero\_, maybe we can setup something up on Jenkins to run the missing includes check once a night?

**08:22 02/25/2014** [Jenkins Build](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-quantal-amd64-gpu-nvidia/295/)
values.title: Fix more saucy cppcheck errors

values.description:
See issue #1036.

* Only the world files that are currently working are installed.

* The broken words are saved in worlds/broken_worlds

* Added a test file for checking that all the world files contained in the worlds directory are SDF compliant.

* Fix some world files.

Some open questions:

* force_torque_demo2.world: Fails due to <implicit_damping> label. Should this label be removed/replaced?

* double_pendulums.world: no error messages but I don't see anything in gazebo.

values.description:
From the series of fixes for non standard directories (part of our work on homebrew) this should fix the problems with ffmpeg related libraries.

In Linux and Mach-O the libraries provide proper pkgconfig files, so let's use them and don't mess with manually looking for headers.
values.title: Fix ffmpeg detection (->gazebo_2.2)

summary.raw:
From the series of fixes for non standard directories (part of our work on homebrew) this should fix the problems with ffmpeg related libraries.

In Linux and Mach-O the libraries provide proper pkgconfig files, so let's use them and don't mess with manually looking for headers.
summary.html:
From the series of fixes for non standard directories (part of our work on homebrew) this should fix the problems with ffmpeg related libraries.

In Linux and Mach-O the libraries provide proper pkgconfig files, so let's use them and don't mess with manually looking for headers.

values.description:
We're starting to see some [test failures in UNIT_gzlog_TEST](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-default-sdformat-default-devel-quantal-amd64/34/testReport/) when the default branch of sdformat is being used, since it is now version "1.5", and causes the shasum's to not match.

This updates the test to tolerate multiple versions of sdformat.
values.title: Adapt gzlog_TEST to tolerate sdf 1.5

summary.raw:
We're starting to see some [test failures in UNIT_gzlog_TEST](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-default-sdformat-default-devel-quantal-amd64/34/testReport/) when the default branch of sdformat is being used, since it is now version "1.5", and causes the shasum's to not match.

This updates the test to tolerate multiple versions of sdformat.
summary.html:
We're starting to see some test failures in UNIT_gzlog_TEST when the default branch of sdformat is being used, since it is now version "1.5", and causes the shasum's to not match.

This updates the test to tolerate multiple versions of sdformat.

values.description:
There's a lot going on here; sorry for the mish-mash. This pull request is to prepare for the bullet party.

1. Refactoring: move two tests related to revolute joints from physics.cc to joint_revolute.cc, nothing changed in the tests.

1. Add more expectations to the 494_joint_axis_frame test and partially fix the ODE and Bullet slider joints (GetGlobalAxis works, but the tests based on GetVelocity and SetVelocity aren't working yet, so they are commented out). Note that you need sdf 1.5 to actually run this test.

1. Add a bunch of expectations to the joint_spawn test, which are applied to every joint. There are a lot of problems here, even with ODE. This is verifying common directionality between GetVelocity, SetVelocity, SetForce, etc. ~~I think I've disabled the failing aspects of this test; I'll check Jenkins.~~ [Jenkins is clean](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-quantal-amd64-gpu-nvidia/310/).
values.title: Joint tests and some fixes

summary.raw:
There's a lot going on here; sorry for the mish-mash. This pull request is to prepare for the bullet party.

1. Refactoring: move two tests related to revolute joints from physics.cc to joint_revolute.cc, nothing changed in the tests.

1. Add more expectations to the 494_joint_axis_frame test and partially fix the ODE and Bullet slider joints (GetGlobalAxis works, but the tests based on GetVelocity and SetVelocity aren't working yet, so they are commented out). Note that you need sdf 1.5 to actually run this test.

1. Add a bunch of expectations to the joint_spawn test, which are applied to every joint. There are a lot of problems here, even with ODE. This is verifying common directionality between GetVelocity, SetVelocity, SetForce, etc. ~~I think I've disabled the failing aspects of this test; I'll check Jenkins.~~ [Jenkins is clean](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-quantal-amd64-gpu-nvidia/310/).
summary.html:
There's a lot going on here; sorry for the mish-mash. This pull request is to prepare for the bullet party.

  1. Refactoring: move two tests related to revolute joints from physics.cc to joint_revolute.cc, nothing changed in the tests.

  2. Add more expectations to the 494_joint_axis_frame test and partially fix the ODE and Bullet slider joints (GetGlobalAxis works, but the tests based on GetVelocity and SetVelocity aren't working yet, so they are commented out). Note that you need sdf 1.5 to actually run this test.

  3. Add a bunch of expectations to the joint_spawn test, which are applied to every joint. There are a lot of problems here, even with ODE. This is verifying common directionality between GetVelocity, SetVelocity, SetForce, etc. I think I've disabled the failing aspects of this test; I'll check Jenkins. Jenkins is clean.

values.description:
A bunch of clang warnings were being generated due to mismatched overloaded virtual functions. For example, a few of the derived `Sensor::Load()` functions were passing the _sdf pointer by reference, which doesn't exactly match the parent definition.

There was an inconsistent type in Get/SetMaxContacts; I converted them all to `int` to match the sdformat type for that parameter.

I converted `Visual::SetWorldPose` to pass the pose by reference (not a warning fix, but an optimization).

I removed the unused variable `bool Model::pluginsLoaded`.

There are some overloaded functions with different arguments than the parent class: `Model::RemoveChild`, `Link::RemoveChild`, and `Link::Update`. For these I applied the `using` keyword to indicate that the parent class function should be considered as well when resolving function names and types.

Partial fix for #1044.
values.title: Fix clang warnings (partial fix for #1044)

summary.raw:
A bunch of clang warnings were being generated due to mismatched overloaded virtual functions. For example, a few of the derived `Sensor::Load()` functions were passing the _sdf pointer by reference, which doesn't exactly match the parent definition.

There was an inconsistent type in Get/SetMaxContacts; I converted them all to `int` to match the sdformat type for that parameter.

I converted `Visual::SetWorldPose` to pass the pose by reference (not a warning fix, but an optimization).

I removed the unused variable `bool Model::pluginsLoaded`.

There are some overloaded functions with different arguments than the parent class: `Model::RemoveChild`, `Link::RemoveChild`, and `Link::Update`. For these I applied the `using` keyword to indicate that the parent class function should be considered as well when resolving function names and types.

Partial fix for #1044.
summary.html:
A bunch of clang warnings were being generated due to mismatched overloaded virtual functions. For example, a few of the derived Sensor::Load() functions were passing the _sdf pointer by reference, which doesn't exactly match the parent definition.

There was an inconsistent type in Get/SetMaxContacts; I converted them all to int to match the sdformat type for that parameter.

I converted Visual::SetWorldPose to pass the pose by reference (not a warning fix, but an optimization).

I removed the unused variable bool Model::pluginsLoaded.

There are some overloaded functions with different arguments than the parent class: Model::RemoveChild, Link::RemoveChild, and Link::Update. For these I applied the using keyword to indicate that the parent class function should be considered as well when resolving function names and types.

Partial fix for #1044.

values.title: Install ModelDatabase.hh on 1.9 (#1067)

values.description:
Let's take this as an ugly workaround.

Story: while testing the Apple built, @scpeters [realized](#!/osrf/gazebo/issue/1026/osx-seg-faults-during-plugin-teardown) that the dlclose call make the tests and plugins to segfault on Mach-O. In my works to prepare the hidden by default symbols branch, I have [realized](#!/osrf/gazebo/issue/1066/tests-segfaults-when-calling-dlclose-on) that exactly the same thing was happening.

I was unable to find the reason (grrrrr) why they are segfaulting under these two circumstances. The workaround is to disable the dlclose call. This should leave the plugin lodaded in memory since the internal counteref is not decrease. 

The point is that I was able to [verify](#!/osrf/gazebo/issue/1066/tests-segfaults-when-calling-dlclose-on#comment-8815755) that after finishing gazebo or tests, the plugin and the rest of gazebo libraries are not loaded in memory any more. So my opinion is that the impact of not unload the plugin at the right moment (specially if this only occurs while closing the app) is limited.
values.title: Disable dlclose call in plugins

summary.raw:
Let's take this as an ugly workaround.

Story: while testing the Apple built, @scpeters [realized](#!/osrf/gazebo/issue/1026/osx-seg-faults-during-plugin-teardown) that the dlclose call make the tests and plugins to segfault on Mach-O. In my works to prepare the hidden by default symbols branch, I have [realized](#!/osrf/gazebo/issue/1066/tests-segfaults-when-calling-dlclose-on) that exactly the same thing was happening.

I was unable to find the reason (grrrrr) why they are segfaulting under these two circumstances. The workaround is to disable the dlclose call. This should leave the plugin lodaded in memory since the internal counteref is not decrease. 

The point is that I was able to [verify](#!/osrf/gazebo/issue/1066/tests-segfaults-when-calling-dlclose-on#comment-8815755) that after finishing gazebo or tests, the plugin and the rest of gazebo libraries are not loaded in memory any more. So my opinion is that the impact of not unload the plugin at the right moment (specially if this only occurs while closing the app) is limited.
summary.html:
Let's take this as an ugly workaround.

Story: while testing the Apple built, @scpeters realized that the dlclose call make the tests and plugins to segfault on Mach-O. In my works to prepare the hidden by default symbols branch, I have realized that exactly the same thing was happening.

I was unable to find the reason (grrrrr) why they are segfaulting under these two circumstances. The workaround is to disable the dlclose call. This should leave the plugin lodaded in memory since the internal counteref is not decrease.

The point is that I was able to verify that after finishing gazebo or tests, the plugin and the rest of gazebo libraries are not loaded in memory any more. So my opinion is that the impact of not unload the plugin at the right moment (specially if this only occurs while closing the app) is limited.

values.description:
Implement the mechanism to support the use ```-fvisibility-inlines-hidden``` and ```-fvisibility=hidden``` in default compilation. This should ends up with a lower number of exported symbols which brings all [kind of benefits](http://gcc.gnu.org/wiki/Visibility) to the project, including faster loading times and less options of breaking the ABI.

Extensive testing will be needed to verify that all our plugin system is broken and dependencies on top of gazebo are not broken. Not only at compilation time, but at running time too (like plugins).

If you see a better way of sending this huge PR, let me know.
values.title: Use hidden symbol visibility by default

summary.raw:
Implement the mechanism to support the use ```-fvisibility-inlines-hidden``` and ```-fvisibility=hidden``` in default compilation. This should ends up with a lower number of exported symbols which brings all [kind of benefits](http://gcc.gnu.org/wiki/Visibility) to the project, including faster loading times and less options of breaking the ABI.

Extensive testing will be needed to verify that all our plugin system is broken and dependencies on top of gazebo are not broken. Not only at compilation time, but at running time too (like plugins).

If you see a better way of sending this huge PR, let me know.
summary.html:
Implement the mechanism to support the use -fvisibility-inlines-hidden and -fvisibility=hidden in default compilation. This should ends up with a lower number of exported symbols which brings all kind of benefits to the project, including faster loading times and less options of breaking the ABI.

Extensive testing will be needed to verify that all our plugin system is broken and dependencies on top of gazebo are not broken. Not only at compilation time, but at running time too (like plugins).

If you see a better way of sending this huge PR, let me know.

values.description:
* Allow setting various ODE PGS options via parameters.
 * Add various ODE PGS parameters pass through to gzclient GUI.
 * Update `GetParam` and `SetParam` for `ODEPhysics` and `SimbodyPhysics` for various parameters.
 * Update and add various ODE error metrics (bilateral, normal, frictional, etc)
 * Add energy (kinetic and potential) calculation in absolute world frame for Links and Models.
 * Update `Joint::ComputeInertiaRatio` to compute ratio across user specified axis.
 * Add `test/integration/pgs_test.cpp` to test various new PGS options used for VRC.
 * Remove `world/stacks.world` - it has no inertia info.  added `test/worlds/sphere_stack.world` with inertia info.
 * Split `physics.proto` into physics engine specific parameter messages.

[Jenkins coverage build](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-coverage-quantal-amd64/39/) Mar 20, 2014 11:48:08 AM
values.title: clean up ode code.  pass through some parameters used in vrc.

summary.raw:
* Allow setting various ODE PGS options via parameters.
 * Add various ODE PGS parameters pass through to gzclient GUI.
 * Update `GetParam` and `SetParam` for `ODEPhysics` and `SimbodyPhysics` for various parameters.
 * Update and add various ODE error metrics (bilateral, normal, frictional, etc)
 * Add energy (kinetic and potential) calculation in absolute world frame for Links and Models.
 * Update `Joint::ComputeInertiaRatio` to compute ratio across user specified axis.
 * Add `test/integration/pgs_test.cpp` to test various new PGS options used for VRC.
 * Remove `world/stacks.world` - it has no inertia info.  added `test/worlds/sphere_stack.world` with inertia info.
 * Split `physics.proto` into physics engine specific parameter messages.

summary.html:
• Allow setting various ODE PGS options via parameters.
  • Add various ODE PGS parameters pass through to gzclient GUI.
  • Update GetParam and SetParam for ODEPhysics and SimbodyPhysics for various parameters.
  • Update and add various ODE error metrics (bilateral, normal, frictional, etc)
  • Add energy (kinetic and potential) calculation in absolute world frame for Links and Models.
  • Update Joint::ComputeInertiaRatio to compute ratio across user specified axis.
  • Add test/integration/pgs_test.cpp to test various new PGS options used for VRC.
  • Remove world/stacks.world - it has no inertia info. added test/worlds/sphere_stack.world with inertia info.
  • Split physics.proto into physics engine specific parameter messages.
